item.title: Speedtest tracking my network
item.description:
Speedtext tracking my network

I like to know what speed i’m getting from my ISP. I found a nifty docker container to do that. The web site also provides instructions for k8s deployment.

Steps

Creating an encryption key

A key is required for encryption. The following command generates a key which can be used in the APP_KEY that will be set later.

echo -n 'base64:'; openssl rand -base64 32;

For ease of retrieval, I have saved that key in a file called APP_KEY.

item.title: Installing InfluxDB
item.description:
Installing InfluxDB

I’m now at the stage where I want to ensure that I can monitor my home lab. Installing InfluxDB is a good initial stage which will allow me to gather, initially, metrix from proxmox which we can later view in Grafana.

The documentation for InfluxDB can be found here.

This article is partly based on Christian Lempa’s work and videos.

I will install InfluxDB on my Docker server as it has more storage than my k3s cluster VMs.
